questions.question:
Which organelle is responsible for protein synthesis?
A. Nucleus
B. Ribosome
C. Mitochondria
D. Golgi apparatus

What is the process by which plants convert sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water into glucose and oxygen?
A. Photosynthesis
B. Respiration
C. Fermentation
D. Transpiration

Which blood type is considered the universal recipient?
A. A
B. B
C. AB
D. O

Which of the following is not a function of the liver?
A. Detoxification
B. Carbohydrate digestion
C. Protein synthesis
D. Bile production

What is the largest organ in the human body?
A. Liver
B. Skin
C. Heart
D. Brain

What is the primary function of red blood cells?
A. Carrying oxygen
B. Fighting infections
C. Blood clotting
D. Transporting nutrients

Which of the following is not a type of muscle tissue?
A. Skeletal
B. Cardiac
C. Smooth
D. Connective

What is the function of the mitochondria?
A. Cellular respiration
B. Photosynthesis
C. Protein synthesis
D. Storage of genetic information

Which of the following is not a phase of mitosis?
A. Prophase
B. Metaphase
C. Anaphase
D. Telophase

What is the role of the pancreas in digestion?
A. Producing bile
B. Absorbing nutrients
C. Regulating blood sugar
D. Producing digestive enzymes

What is the process by which cells break down glucose to release energy?
A. Photosynthesis
B. Respiration
C. Fermentation
D. Transpiration

Which of the following is not a function of the skeletal system?
A. Protection of internal organs
B. Blood cell production
C. Regulation of body temperature
D. Movement

What is the site of gas exchange in the respiratory system?
A. Trachea
B. Larynx
C. Alveoli
D. Bronchi

Which of the following is a function of the circulatory system?
A. Oxygen transport
B. Digestion of food
C. Production of hormones
D. Filtering waste products

What is the purpose of the immune system?
A. Transporting nutrients
B. Regulating body temperature
C. Fighting infections
D. Controlling hormone production

What is the function of the cerebrum?
A. Muscle coordination
B. Breathing control
C. Memory and thinking
D. Digestion of food

Which of the following is not a type of blood vessel?
A. Artery
B. Vein
C. Capillary
D. Ligament

What is the role of the urinary system?
A. Regulating blood sugar
B. Producing digestive enzymes
C. Filtering waste from the blood
D. Transporting oxygen

Which of the following is not a type of tissue?
A. Epithelial
B. Connective
C. Nervous
D. Muscular

What is the function of the endocrine system?
A. Fighting infections
B. Controlling hormone production
C. Regulating body temperature
D. Transporting nutrients

What is the purpose of meiosis?
A. Growth and repair
B. Asexual reproduction
C. Gamete production
D. Digestion of food

Which of the following is not a component of the nervous system?
A. Brain
B. Spinal cord
C. Nerves
D. Muscles

What is the role of the hypothalamus?
A. Regulation of body temperature
B. Muscle coordination
C. Memory and thinking
D. Digestion of food

Which of the following is not a type of cell division?
A. Mitosis
B. Meiosis
C. Binary fission
D. Fermentation

What is the purpose of the reproductive system?
A. Regulation of body temperature
B. Muscle coordination
C. Memory and thinking
D. Reproduction

Which of the following is not an example of an inherited trait?
A. Eye color
B. Height
C. Language proficiency
D. Blood type

What is the function of the white blood cells?
A. Carrying oxygen
B. Fighting infections
C. Blood clotting
D. Transporting nutrients

Which of the following is not a type of cell?
A. Neuron
B. Muscle cell
C. Red blood cell
D. Connective tissue cell

What is the process by which plants lose water through their leaves?
A. Photosynthesis
B. Respiration
C. Fermentation
D. Transpiration

What is the function of the ribosomes?
A. Cellular respiration
B. Photosynthesis
C. Protein synthesis
D. Storage of genetic information

Which of the following is not a component of blood?
A. Plasma
B. Platelets
C. Red blood cells
D. Cartilage

What is the purpose of the digestive system?
A. Regulating blood sugar
B. Producing digestive enzymes
C. Filtering waste from the blood
D. Transporting oxygen

Which of the following is not a function of the skin?
A. Protection
B. Sensation
C. Respiration
D. Temperature regulation

What is the function of the nucleus?
A. Cellular respiration
B. Photosynthesis
C. Protein synthesis
D. Storage of genetic information
